This swashbuckling adventure had all the trappings of an Errol Flynn epic, Mutiny on the Bounty and yes, you can still hear Maximus in Russell Crowe's voice. Max Pirkis(Midshipman Blakeney), in his movie debut, shows this young man can have a future in film, if he desires. His emotional display during the amputation scene was felt by the entire audience. Every woman in there wanted to hug him. Every man admired him. Paul Bettany (Dr. Stephen Maturin) helped to keep Russell Crowe from taking himself too seriously in this movie. The Captain has the command presence expected of someone in his position. He is an inspirational leader, leading by example. He is a role model and father figure to the young midshipman. His strong sense of duty and patriotism drives him to go above and beyond what is expected in his mission. This movie should do very well in the box offices and do even better on DVD. This is definitely a keeper.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: If there is a film that is worthy of 10 stars in the IMDB rating system, this movie is it.  Crowe is fantastic as the captain.  The historical accuracy if the film is also stunning.  Men taking orders from a boy that appears to be no older than 12.  Putting their lives in his hands.  That may seem unrealistic in this time, but that was indeed what happened.  I cannot say enough about the movie, but I do not want to spoil anything for anyone. This may not be a good review at all, and my opinions may not mean much, but I do know that this film is Oscar-worthy. The film has the best mix of emotions: from suspense, to joy, to sadness and despair. I think that this movie is something everyone needs to see.  If you don't enjoy it, that's one thing, but you cannot deny this movie's greatness.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: What can I say?  I really wanted to love this movie.  It was not a bad film, it just did not grab me.  It felt like a re-enactment on the History channel but with better actors.  I was bored.  Russell Crowe was good but  it was not one of his more challenging roles.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: This movie by far is the best I've seen all year, and the best sea adventure movie ever. The way the battle scenes were directed gave it realism, making you feel that you are right there in the action.The movie wasn't all action as some might suspect. It was well balanced with character development, battle strategy, as well as small side stories(for instance the bad luck with the boy they likened to Jonah). One thing that impressed me a lot in this film was MEANINGFUL DIALOGUE, one thing that has been missing from most modern movies. It really played a part in learning the characters past, interests, and insight on upcoming events. Overall this movie was great, a little long, but the length was necessary to the story.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: thank god that ended when it did. The movie has created a new word or atleast a new meanig for an old word.....snooooring. A combination of Snooze and Boring cuz thats what this is. If I wanted to watch Horatio Hornblower I would have stayed home. Lame. Dont be trendy and agree with the media, cast this as lame and boring which is what you actually thought.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review title: "They mean to take us for a prise........."
Review_body: perfect movie. best actors for the roles, best portrayal of English seamen in 1805 as for as I know, and best dialogue. Brilliantly directed and produced, Especially during a time when movies were hitting all time lows'. I found nothing wrong with this movie besides the fact that I cannot watch it over and over, for I do not want to ruin it.Best work by Russel Crowe I have ever seen! He depicted a commander perfectly like he always does and set himself aside from the other crewmen like a commander should. The other actors complimented this film as well.The one thing i did not like is that it should have been longer, but that might have not been a option for the producer.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review title: BEST MOST REALISTIC SAILING MOVIE EVER MADE
Review_body: Thank goodness someone still knows how to make a real movie. It is like getting into a time machine and traveling back in time to see what it was like to be on an english battle sailing ship. This is Russel Crow's finest performance yet. "Master" is the right word. A master performance. This movie should deserve acadamy award nominations. I am a sailor and this is the best sailing movie I have ever seen in my life. These characters were so believable. The performances were impecable.I give this movie a 10 out of 10.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body:
This is one of the worst movies ever made. If you need to get some shut eye then this is the movie for you. Castaway will be considered to be an action packed movie compared to this!  I hope you enjoyed all the action you saw in the previews for this movie because that's it folks.Whoever said that this is like Gladiator of the sea must have never seen Gladiator.  Whoever enjoyed this movie must love being bored. They could have wrapped this movie up in about 15-20 minutes. About 90% of this movie is mumbling and rambling dialogue that has nothing to do with the plot.
Don't waste your time or money on this bomb. You're better off watching Gigli.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: I just got back from seeing the movie and one word can describe this movie: mesmerizing. The special effects were great, they really made you 'at sea'. The action was great and all the individual charactors did there parts well. Not sure why there was little kids in charge of the ship but oh well they proved to be great. Good job to Crowe too, he plays the hero very well, and sometimes had some small humor to keep the audience happy. Parts seemed like they would drag on but did not, great plots and well executed. Good job to weir and crowe. 9/10
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: crowe was perfectly casted and did an excellent job.  he was very compelling to watch.  the hollywood-esque screenplay, homosexual overtones (probably to make up for the lack of sex scenes) and disbelief that a ship war-time captain (a good one at least) makes that many decisions based on emotions turned me off.  it could have been a great movie but it was just too trite.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: As a huge fan of the Aubrey/Maturin novels I was slightly worried about seeing the film, as book adaptions often have a habit of going ary and become not so much entertainment for the audience as much as a form of mild torture. Master and Commander however is perhaps the best book adaption I have ever seen, it was an absolute joy to watch from beginning to end, and a general knowledge of 18-early 19th century ships just makes the whole thing even better. The sheer detail of the film was just incredible (Pirates of the Caribbean eat your heart out) Not a belaying pin out of place(apart of course from when the Surprise gets hammered in that extraordinary first combat). One of the masterstrokes of the film was not to base the film on any one specific book, Eg in Master and Commander Mr Pullings is only a 2nd lieutenant and Aubrey is captain of the Sophie.Yet still retaining the relationships between the characters (especially between Captain Aubrey and Stephen Maturin) which is one of the great cornerstones of the novels. The whole film was Exiting, realistic, heartfelt and in some places just a really good laugh as the film contains many of Aubrey's finest jokes.Thoroughly recommended; be you sailor, lubber or just a true film lover.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: Maybe I should have had more sleep the night before seeing this movie than the six hours I got. But I was trying to keep my eyes open during the first half of the film. During the second half I perked up a bit as the storyline started moving along to its conclusion more rapidly and steadily. And I started understanding the characters. I think a large failing of this movie is that it expects you to already have an intimate understanding of the characters and the dynamics between them. However, that didn't develop for me until the latter half of the movie, so the first part felt forced. Again, maybe I was tired, because other people around me were laughing in spots that were meant to be funny, while I didn't even crack a smile. However, my colleague and I (we work in evolutionary psychology) were the only ones I heard laugh at the line (I think it was by Crowe's character) about Bettany's character being the first naturalist to set foot on the Galapagos Islands.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: Visually this was an impressive film and Russel Crowe's screen presence held my attention throughout. However, I felt that the film could have benefited by also showing the story from the French crew's point of view. A battle of wills between the French and English captains would have really brought the whole thing to life (see Pacino / De Niro in Heat).Judging by the box office success I guess there will be a sequel and hopefully they can add a bit more "spice" to the story.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review title: A true masterpiece which deserves more attention
Review_body: This is one of that movies that you need to watch several times to truly understand and appreciate all details. In some parts it can look a bit slow and difficult to follow but every part has a meaningThere is history, action, adventure, exploration. The plot is interesting and awfully interrupted at the end crying for a sequel.Probably a 99% men movie, that's fine but women should watch it just to see the two main characters played by Crowe and Bettany, their different ways to be a man at that time, in that world and to be deeply friends even with very different visions of life and ideals.The acting, the environment, the accuracy of the ships and sets reconstruction are amazing and everything was done without any CG as far as I can tell. This movie can really bring you there with them if you let it.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: I don't watch movies in theartres unless my friends drag me there.  But yesterday I dragged a friend to see this movie because I'm a fan of Russell Crowe.  The movie presented a series of beautiful pictures.  Other than that, the only thing I can only say is that it has been the most uncomfortable experience I have ever had in a movie theatre.  The plot didn't get interesting until the last 15 minutes of the movie; the first two hours were full of long gaps and scattered pieces that don't relate to each other, although some of them were heart-warming and dramatic on their own. The characterization of this film failed Russell Crowe; he was made less a character than other roles such as the physician and the little boy.  I fought alongside Maximus in the colosseum and followed John Nash's thought when he wrote on the math window in Princeton's library, but this time, I was sitting in the theatre, sickened.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review title: A masterful film with faulty publicity.
Review_body: I had to be dragged to see this film.  From the previews I thought it would be boring as all get-out with lots of rain and waves and yelling and explosions.  But, I was wrong.  I have never seen a film billed so incorrectly.  There were some action sequences, but such events were not the focus of the plot.  Peter Weir chose, instead, to entertain the viewer with rich dialogue that advanced the storyline better than any explosion ever could.  I can understand some viewers being disappointed in the epic with it's long sequences of calm, but, any perceptive, eager-minded movie goer will be satisfied with it's quality.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: Russell Crowe doesn't even attempt a British accent. So it's a bit odd hearing him rally the troops in the service of her majesty. Add in numerous other plot flaws and you have a pretty poor movie.How did this get such good ratings?
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: Have to say that Master and Commander is one ofthe better pictures i have seen this year. Crowe is as usual very good, but it was his supporting cast that really made the picture worht watching. i love this movie
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body:
It was kind of dull.   Well maybe I am being too hard.  If you are a 50-year-old male who owns a boat, you will like it.Contrary to the trailer, Gladiator it is not.   In the 2 very brief battles (the first one if you blink it is over - saw most of it on the trailers) there is some really cool cannon stuff.  But that was it.  15-20 minutes of action in a 2 hour and 18 minute film doesn't make it an action.  It makes it a long drama.When you finally get to see the bad guys at the end of the movie they should have worn black cowboy hats because I kept getting the good guys and bad guys mixed up in the fighting.It is a story (or a documentary) about sailing and life on a boat a couple a hundred years ago.  That is what the trailers should show and stop trying to trick the public.Sorry. I didn't read the books but I bet you the books had humor and women. This movie had neither.  Gladiator had the strength of the emperor's sister and Gladiator's love for his wife and child and his desire to be with them again.  Nope. Not in this film.If anyone thinks this is Pirates of the Caribbean, think again.    It is a visually pretty History Channel documentary.  If that is what you are looking for, go see this movie.  If you are not, don't.
When you read some of the comments here everyone seems to talk about it as visual poetry.  I think those comments are fair.   But the simple fact is it is a "chick-flick for guys who like boats."  They should promote it as such. Most of the action is in the trailers.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: This is a terrific reproduction of the "look and feel" of the Aubrey books. True to style, close attention to detail (find another movie where the foremast jacks are barefoot!) and a reluctance to pander to cliche make this an epic. As a naval commander myself, even now in the days of steel ships one recognizes the traditions that the (Canadian) navy keeps alive in the wardroom (officer's mess), the gunroom (the home of the midshipmen) and in the hand's mess.The battle scenes are as authentic as Patrick OBrien made them, without the lamentable urge to explode things in blazes of flame.And as a professional string player, I recognize the intimate scenes with instruments do reflect OBrien's vision of dimensions of Aubrey and Maturin's characters well. I too have brought my cello on naval deployments - though I never had the luxury of a great cabin large enough to play a cello in aboard ship.I loved the movie.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review title: Blockbuster, or history channel archive film
Review_body: Going into this film i was expecting great naval battles, perhaps an entertaining chase. I would have been satisfied sitting home watching paint dry. The film begins with a short battle, ok seems interesting. I was then fooled into 2 hours of seamen singing songs, crude surgical procedures and useless plot material. Perhaps one major error in this film was neglecting to develop any of the French vessels crew. Just having a "phantom" boat being the enemy doesn't quite do it. This film could have  been many things, a "how to" rebuild a 19th century ship. Not a terrible film overall, almost there though. Acting was solid, I bet the script looked better on paper. Maybe we should change the title to Master and Explorer, it could have been an adventure change the plot a little but you can't disguise this thing as an action packed military film.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: I have read all he books, I am not a big fan of Russel Crowe, I wasn't happy they where picking and choosing from a bunch of books, and I complained about how Hollywood would screw this up for he last six months and... It was an excellent movie.  It truly captured the feel of the books.  I expected them to make an action movie with some cool effects and not much else(that seems to satisfy enough people for a movie to make its money).  They could have made a stale period piece, like those Gettysburg or Gods and Generals, that satisfy obsessive history buffs but don't have any drama, They didn't. They made an excellent movie, with an exciting pace, that happened to take place all on a  ship and a deserted island. I don't want to give any points away, if you want to see the terminator vintage 1805 and have the attention span of a flea, you'll be as disappointed as a few others who have written here have, If you want tortured protagonists and excessive pathos, go see Mystic River( which was great), but if you want to be taken on an interesting adventure, with compelling characters, that doesn't insult your intelligence I think you will like this movie.  thanks to good writing, directing and cinematography, you will really feel like you've been cramped on a tiny frigate, and chasing a superior enemy across two oceans. (yeah it is supposed to feel long when you are stuck in the doldrums!) I can be a movie snob, i usually point out what was wrong with most movies I like, but I think they did as well as possible, only one scene was over-dramatic (Jonah).  You should still read the books, Stephen is more complex and Jack has more flaws. a sequel should have more on land, where roles are reversed and they can work in Diana and Sophie.  I didn't think Hollywood could make good movies from books, but with help from the folks down under they've done well the last few years.  Finally, I think I have forgiven Crowe, for that God-awful Gladiator, I'm sure he can sleep better knowing that. Well, worth your $8.00---------10/10
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: The attention to detail in this film is astounding.  That aspect alone would be enough to carry it; however, when you couple the detail with the story, the battles, and the comaraderie on board the ship, you have for your viewing pleasure an absolute gem.The surgery scenes are especially incredible to witness.  I'd imagine the doctors on board the ships of that era handled things much the same as they are dealt with in the film.Paul Bettany is a joy to watch as Stephen Maturin.  Russell Crowe plays Lucky Jack in much the same way I'd envisioned Jack in the novels.  In fact, all of the actors play their parts perfectly.I highly recommend this movie.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: I was really looking forward to this flick. What a HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT. The story made little sense, the battle scenes were very poorly done - hey director: shaking the camera does make not me think that the battle action is fast-paced and confusing - it makes me think it's too fast and confusing FOR YOU!.  On the snooty side- character development was poorly done for several of the seemingly key figures; either that or the editing was terrible, as you must have left many key shots and dialogue on the cutting room floor. As is, the entire film should be left on floor. This film is the triumph of commercial and marketing hype over reason. Your ads and specials said it was good, so all the lemmings voting on this board follow through to be with the crowd.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review title: Classic Film For A New Generation
Review_body: Beautiful film, quality from beginning to end.  Russell Crowe just keeps getting better and better with each new performance.  You need to see this film two times, because you will be highly enriched by the second viewing. Peter Weir a Master and Commander at directing, has created a classic masterpiece. Academy Awards potential looks emminent, the battles, the chase, the relationships of the crew and its Captain, the friendship between the Ships Surgeon and the Captain are at the heart of the story.  I think what stands out is integrety and honor, to put duty to the forefront and to care about the people under your leadership.  This is the best film of the year.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review title: The most sublime fadeout in movie history.
Review_body: Patrick O'Brian must have been whispering encouragement in Peter Weir's ears during the screen writing of this masterful film. The story is pure O'Brian, Crowe is Aubrey without even trying, Bettany is Maturin in every way (except height, and it makes no difference to the film) and the Surprise and her crew are impeccable. History will come to rate it with the best of the best.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: This was a very, very good movie.  My wife and I loved it.  Very realistic we thought.  And a clean movie! The cinematography was enthralling and the Gallopogos Islands were a very entertaining segment.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review title: Visually powerful, action however a string of absurdities
Review_body: Note: I will discuss some detail of the action.The small British frigate Surprise chases a French privateer bound for the pacific to take British whalers. The privateer pops suddenly out of dense fog and starts immediately firing at the Surprise with deadly accuracy at a distance at which the guns of the Surprise can't bear. I suspect the French had radar for fire control. The Surprise manages to get away in the fog, badly damaged.It turns out that the French sail a frigate of the Constitution class bought from the US. How can they afford what was at the time the most advanced type of frigate and why would the US sell it in the first place? How will they ever make a profit catching whalers? Privateering is a business, you know.Later the officer of the marines wants to shoot an albatross. He performs a wild dance, turning in circles and wildly flailing the gun. He ends up hitting the doctor in the belly.The British finally catch up with the enemy. Since the French will blow them out of the water in a straight fight, they decide to board. So they disguise the Surprise as a whaler. Now that is like disguising a tank to look like a pickup truck. Anyway, captain Aubrey is worried that the French will try to get away once they realize that they are facing the Surprise and decides to cripple them by shooting a mast down. Unfortunately the guns do not have the elevation to do so at boarding distance, so Aubrey runs them out and has the rear wheels removed from the gun carriages. This gives the British just one shot since the guns can't recoil. He also sends the marines (in disguise) up into the rigging so they can take out the French crew. The French do not notice the guns and the men in the rigging and get taken by surprise (pun taken right from the movie).All this is quite ridiculous: Knocking down a mast with just one salvo would be exceedingly lucky, even at close range and anyway, only a couple of feet away are the French, vastly outnumbering the English and a wonderful target for grape shot and chain and all the other nasty stuff one can put into a gun.Whoever wrote the screen play had no clue.The movie ends with a cliffhanger, a sequel is likely.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: Sucked - boring -  too long.  Very noisy movie and the dialog was inaudible at times.  It may have been realistic to the period and detailed as to the ship etc, but you need a better story to hold your interest.  I was ready to leave mid-point. . .took a sneak peak in another theater showing The Missing and that looked like a great movie from the little bit I caught before returning to the dreadful battle at sea!
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: My expectations were, I confess, rather low. A plot drawn from several of the novels, centred around an extended chase, missing out much of the splendid social and personal elements of the books and, worse yet, the horrible miscasting of Russell Crowe as Jack Aubrey. It sounded ominously like another great literary work being churned and processed into a disappointing film.Under the care of Peter Weir, however, the film has become something far beyond adequate or respectable. It may be more Hornblower than Aubrey, but this is a very fine naval film indeed. True, it's hard to accept Crowe as Lucky Jack, but he has a good stab at it and does portray elements of the character (notably when he's drunk, when he's in combat and when he's voicing his authority) excellently. Only when faced with extended, emotional dialogue does he falter. Likewise Maturin on screen is not Maturin in the book, but to be fair the whole cast do such a good job that it is almost possible to forget the novels for a time and revel in a fine tale wonderfully told. David Threlfall deserves special mention, though, for stepping directly from the pages of O'Brian onto the screen as Preserved Killick.Rousing battles, lavish production, delightful details, and just enough of the wit and humanity of the books to raise the whole above the typical naval yarn. It might not be the adaptation we dreamed of seeing, but it's far beyond that which we had any right to expect.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: Russell Crowe is perfect as Aubrey - look like he should and acts like he would act. Paul Bettany is excellent as Maturin - not as dark and unpretty as I imagined, but excellent nonetheless. David Threlfall IS Preserved Killick - "which I was already getting your coat..."Not as much character development as O'Brian, but no time in a single movie. Battle scenes outstanding. Ships, weather, etc., very realistic.Borrowed parts from several books, but with 20 books and only one two or...] movie, how could you not? The way it ends, a sequel has to be in the works.Only one goof I noticed: Stephen boarded the French ship during the battle - he would never have done that. But no big deal.I highly recommend it.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: One of the best movies of 2003.  Russell Crowe gives a wonderful performance but, Paul Bettany and Max Pirkis really shine as outstanding actors in this well done period piece.  Bettany & Pirkis should receive 'Best Supporting-Actor' nominations.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: The battle-scenes in this film had me feeling that I was involved in them: exhausting and exciting. It was almost a surprise to leave the cinema not drenched in sea-water! The fine detail of life aboard ship in the early 19th Century was impressive, as well as the way in which the plot enabled the viewer to understand better what motivated seamen to put up with what they did in spite of the appalling conditions of life at sea on a wooden sailing ship.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: To be honest, I went to see Russel Crowe. And I've seen. Plenty and at his best. But to say just this would be quite unfair, because the film is great (I really don't understand those who got bored - very low threshold) and not only the RC - Paul Bettany duett, but the entire crew did a fine job. I loved every minute of it, despite the slight seasickness i felt occasionally. Hey, did anyone notice that the unfortunate Mowett (Jonah guy) looked a bit like prince Charles? And yes, Russel Crowe is a master and a commander. When do we get to see him in an Insider kinda job?
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: Inspired me read all 20 of the books.  This is one of the best series of books ever written, made into one of the best movies possible. I have seen it numerous times and have encouraged everyone I know to check it out.  I took my 10 year-old grandson to see it. He found it to be exciting and a great example of what kids used to live like.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review title: The most realistic film which I saw
Review_body: So, the first I must say that I really love sailing although our republic haven´t sea. So I was really pleased for this film.I think it is very realistic and I am glad that the film are not so romantic like the other films of this genre.Thank you very much for this film
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: In the words of Homer Simpson:  " Bbbbbbbooooooooorrrrrriiiiiiing!!!!" The reviews and trailer of this film led me terribly astray.  I was so excited to see this one.  How disappointed I was, then, when I had to sit through 2.5 hours of a misguided, confused film full of Hollywood cliches.  What a waste.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: Followed the books (the first and tenth book of the Aubrey-Maturin novels) quite well. One comes away with a very strong, visceral feeling of what life was like on a ship back then--the crowded and unsanitary conditions, the amputations, the flogging, the food (mmm weevils), the pecking order, inclement weather, the strategy of a chase and the ultimate taking of a prize. Russell Crowe wouldn't have been my first choice for the role of "Lucky Jack", but he proved a fine captain, loyal to the character in the books. Maturin was most convincing and also true to books. ...and by the way, this is not a "guy" film (I'm a chick and I loved it), it's a film for anyone who enjoys all things seafaring--from ships to sea shanties (with some swashbuckling thrown in).
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review title: The best movie I have seen all year!
Review_body: This is one of the best movies I have ever seen.  Great script and acting. Beautiful cinematography and exciting music.  A story that grows on you, as you watch the movie and after you have left the theater.  If you like magnificent sailing ships, you will love this movie.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: One of the best movies ever made. Thought has been given to every frame, it is a pleasure to watch! This movie is worth every oscar it might get. Some scenes are so good that they give you shivers down your spine. It truly feels like you are thrown 200 years back in time. This film must be enjoyed at the cinemas or with a good home entertainment system.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: What impressed me about this movie as much as the historical recreation of this era in the Royal Navy was the lack of pretence and the determination to stick to the language and attitudes of the day. Instead of resorting to trendy dialogue or contemporary humour to cheaply gain laughter, Master and Commander aims to be a landmark film that can be appreciated in the long-term as well as the short. The film makes the viewer think of what these sailors must have experienced at a time when Britain through competition with other European countries was determined to rule the waves. Here's hoping for a sequel or two!
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: This movie is a masterpiece of movie construction.  The plot is intellectually superior to any movie I've seen in a long time.  Character development, acting, directing, and editing are all fantastic.  But, the timing was rather unfortunate for this movie.  Return of the king stole 9 of the 10 Master and Commander Oscar nominations and probably stole a significant amount of money from Master and Commander due to it being out at the same time.  But it took a lot of guts to make this movie the way it was done.  It was original, creative, and extremely competently made.  It deserves a better rating than 7.5.  Anyone who says this movie is less than an 8 does not know anything about movies.  I give it a 10 and I haven't given that rating to any other movie I've rated.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: I can not get enough of the Aubrey/Maturin saga.  I loved the movie so much that I have purchased 13 of the 20 books in the series so far.  I feel that the movie was well written and produced.  It makes me want more.  I keep buying books related to Naval Warfare during that era.  My only gripe is that it started at book 10 in the series.  There are 9 books worth of great movie material before Master & Commander even starts.  Not to mention 10 books after.  It is obvious to anyone who knows the series and saw the movie.  There not only needs to be a sequel (or 2), but at least one prequel.  I wouldn't be happier if the turned this into a trilogy or, better yet, a quintrilogy.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: In my point of view this movie could have been done better. The story felt very thin, i even took a little nap when i watched it. It isnt often a movie from that specific period of our history appears on the movie theatres. so at first, this film looked extremely exciting, a must see movie. And the great actor Russell Crowe plays the main character, must be a great movie !!! i thought,I can congratulate the "smart" movie company that hired Russell Crowe, only his name will boost the selling of tickets, to this poor thin sleepy story.You could have done this better.Rollx
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review title: One of the best history movies
Review_body: I love history and this movie! I thought this movie was great. Russell Crow and Paul Bettany  are two are my favorite actors. This action packed flick really beautifully portrayed the battle on the seas that this time in history. I know a movie is good when I get a rush when watching it. I was sitting at the theater in awe. I thought the actors were so good and they really did their job well. I was upset when this movie did not get the Oscar for Best Picture. The costume design was also very well done. I was upset when Lord Of the Rings took all 11 Oscars. My favorite character is the Doc. I am so excited for the DVD in April. I hope there are other movies that are of this quality.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: My husband knowing I am a big Russell Crowe fan purchased this movie for me the day it came out on DVD, and I have watched it a dozen times or more. Crowe and Bettany are awesome together, as well as the other characters. I especially enjoyed the violin scenes together the soundtrack is awesome. This is a movie I enjoy watching every second from beginning to end.*******SPOILER********* Below regarding ending:Loved the surprised ending and the look on Jack's face when he realized that the Captain was not dead!!! Wow would love to see a sequel I think it would be awesome.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body:
an interest in the "era of fighting sail" would lead a reader through several nautical series including c. s. forester (horatio hornblower), alexander kent (richard bolitho), dudley pope (nicholas ramage), dewey lambdin (alan lewrie), and eventually patrick o'brian (jack aubrey).
to anyone who has read these series, the o'brian books are hands-down the most boring and least accurate (historically or technically) of the lot. why peter weir and miramax dumped $150M into such pathetic storytelling is beyond me.committed to one of patrick o'brian's banal efforts, we now have a film guaranteed to be trite, dull, and frequently nonsensical. i will give full points to the cinematography, however. the sailing scenes were breathtaking and worth nearly any degree of idiocy to watch.i was glad that i had seen this film, but will not buy a copy of it. pity. maybe if weir had read alexander kent instead...
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review title: I had a bad feeling about this movie....
Review_body: ...probably because the previews portrayed it to me as an odd combination of 'Pirates of the Caribbean' and 'The Perfect Storm, that left my aesthetic sense dreading the idea (color/visual variety and shot juxtaposition-wise) of a movie shot almost entirely at sea--a setting that yields potentially monotonous combinations of blue sea, grey fog, and brown hull.However, in this film, that drudging monotony of color reflected the dutiful behavior of the military "commander" and his crew in the film, and the extended toil of their long and exhausting journey. Being who I am, I kept getting so P***ED that the Doctor character kept getting SCREWED OVER whenever he tried to go to the Galapagos to collect samples for scientific study.Yet, despite my initial indignation, I soon realized that this misfortune also showed (ultimately) the necessity of the captain's sacrifice or repression of all other endeavors and personal vendettas in order to complete his assigned mission. It isn't a pleasure cruise the crew is on: they have orders that must be followed. Even if it means screwing the lovable doctor and the rest of the world out of fascinating new biological discoveries that lay only a stone's throw away. These conflicts made the movie for me: the obligations of a leader to his country clashing with his personal loyalties to friends and crew, and the related conflict of whether it is best to prioritize the military or the erudite when time and resources are in short supply.So, I still think it is not -my- type of movie, exactly. But, certain things I recall with admiration--the sly camera-work, for example, like the bouncing of the camera offside of the "ship" (mimicking the undulation of waves) done in combination with the rocking movement of the actual ship set piece was a nice subtle touch. And the characters were well developed (or well played, if not both). The children, the officers, the crew and captain were all memorable and demanded empathy from the movie-going audience -- even if you did enter (like me) convinced the film was going to be an epic lacking cinematographic grandeur and bursting with sappy (Seabiscuit style) dialogue.My apologies to those who love Seabiscuit. Again, not my type of film.But this one was well done. I especially was struck seeing snippets of it a second time when my grandmother insisted on watching it again to get more time alone with Russell Crowe.Oi.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review title: Best technical direction and acting I have seen.
Review_body: This is an excellent motion picture. It is what all films should be in terms of professional quality and historical accuracy. No car chases, pratfalls, spinning cameras, gratuitous sex, strobing, etc., and no Hollywood Film School formula script. A truly great film with balanced and true to life characters, plenty of action and a cultural truism not found in other films. This movie should have received better promotion. I wish Hollywood would make more films from the Patrick O'Brien novels about these characters, with the same actors and director. Peter Weir did a fantastic job, as did Russell Crowe and the rest of the cast. I never tire of watching this film.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: i was really impressed by this movie.it was amazing the way that the movie depicted the real thing in all angles. i love how the movie shows the young shipmates trying to earn their status in society. there was a whole other story along with the one about the battle,the story about how the crew was their family, about what men went through just to say that they are worth more than the dirt in the gutters. there was also the story of sacrifice and love; not a love between a man and a woman but a love between a captain and his ship. this movie has a lot of meaning to it and i don't think there is one person who wont appreciate what it has to tell us.i recommend this movie to a mature audience whatever that age may be but please do not bring a child with no discipline seeing as you wont want to be interrupted while watching this blockbuster.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: Set during the Napoleonic War, Master and Commander paints a good picture of life aboard a warship. Aboard the HMS Surprise, the British Captain Jack , a fearless strategist, battles the French ship the Acheron. Although there are slower scenes depicting the monotony of travel on the high seas, there are also graphic scenes of sailors getting wounded and receiving treatment. It also portrays the relationships of the crew and hardships of battle at sea. The drama between Russell Crowe's Captain Jack and his friend Steven Maturin is especially well-acted. It's somewhat harder to tell the difference between some of the minor characters who get lost in the mix with bad lighting and poor weather. Overall, this is a good movie and I would definitely recommend it to friends.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: i did not get to see Master and Commander in the theatre, but finally did see it on hbo on demand.. well, it is simply the most awesome , engrossing , stunningly beautiful movie i have ever seen! the story, the cast, the cinematography, the characters... usually i like romantic comedies, but this work of art, had me enchanted and spellbound from beginning to end. i have since watched it over and over and over numerous times. of course, Russell Crowe is outstanding in his performance, but it seems the entire cast was fantastic and so believable! i especially loved James D'arcy as the 1st Lieutenant Tom Pullings. i loved the scenes at the dinner table, singing songs, drinking, and joking and laughing! these personalities seem bigger than life! also,i loved a lot of the cinematography, of how the camera would pull back and show the two ships...and the ocean...with that beautiful music playing in the background. i bought the cd of master and commander because i also loved the music too so much! i cant say enough about this film..it is one i will watch over and over again, never tire of...i love the interaction of the characters, and the depth which the film reveals of each one. thank you Peter Weir... i also loved your other film Witness..that is another one i watch and never tire of. MASTER AND COMMANDER...THE BEST FROM THIS SIDE OF THE WORLD! WITH LOVE AND APPRECIATION, CARLA
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: The begin of the movie is good, but it is the only good spot in it. The whole movie is too long and it has no beginning and no end. All you get from it is two battles that make no sense. Peter Weir has shown us that he is able to make good movies such as Gallipoli or The Truman Show, but this time he wasn't able to convince the audience. The movie was a failure in all the lines. It should have been a lot shorter and the story, that seems to be a good one, needs a little of correction on the beginning and in the end, so that the movie would finally made some sense. The visual effects and the camera are great, but this still cannot stop the film from sinking. It really could have been an epic spectacle, but now it is not even an average movie because of the missing parts of the story. The only bright spot together with the beginning is Russell Crowe, but one actor cannot change the fact that this film was in the depths before it even came out.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: I was first bothered to see, when i came to the IMDb.com site for Master and Commander that the sample review that was available was that of a person who hated the film. It upset me, but i have no real problem with it. In fact, it's good to see that there is a difference of opinion. It is hard for me to remember what i first thought when i first saw the movie, because since then i have completely delved myself into the world of Patrick O'Brian. First of all, let me say that i must have liked the movie well enough to buy it, because i now own it and watch it a lot. What i think made this movie great was the fact that it got me to read the books. i loved it so much, i went out and bought the books. The movie, unlike what was stated in a previous review, is not overly-nautical. In fact, it explains very little of the nautical process, unlike the books. It took me several weeks and about 2 or 3 books into the series to figure out the nautical terms, and i still have trouble with a few, but i'm much better now. Speaking of the books, this review said that 'Purportedly it's factual and based on real people'- wrong. It is based on the books. And in fact, it is not entirely based on the books in which it is named after (Master and Commander- the 1st book, and The Far Side of the World- the 10th book). The "lesser of two weevils' joke is taken from the 6th book, and the plot is not from the 1st book at all and only bits of it are from the 10th book, other elements of the movie are taken from various other books. WHat makes this movie so great is the fact that it melded these elements wonderfully, without being overly-nautical. Paul Bettany, being my favorite, did excellent, though he really didn't have much (in comparison to the character in the books). Russel Crowe i thought did great- he really captured the character wonderfully, minus the occasional stupidity exampled by the character in the book. There are several elements about this movie that make it a movie and not an adaptation of the book. For instance, in the book, Jack is fat and Staphen is ugly- this is obviously not the case in the movie. It wouldn't work well in the books, but it works magnificently in the movie, and i'm glad i saw the movie before i read the books, though i don't think i would have been disappointed had i read the books, then seen the movie. The whole point of this is to simply say that if (1) the movie was half as nautical as this viewer might think, then he would have been too lost to even finish the movie. He wouldn't even know how they got from one place to the other (as i often am in the books). (2) It's not based on true events, it's based on books. And in all of those points, are my opinions. Enjoy.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review title: They've captured the rhythm of life at sea perfectly.
Review_body: As a 25 year veteran of the US Navy, most of my sea time on submarines, the one thing that strikes me about this film is how well they've captured the rhythm of life at sea. The routines of watchstanding, crew meals both in the wardroom and lower decks, the occasional "beating to quarters" or all hands on deck to handle some casualty or other, are all very real. Even in today's nuclear Navy, some things haven't changed. It was very easy for me, and should be for anyone who's worn the blue and served at sea, to be able to relate well to this film. I sincerely hope that Peter Weir will make another O'Brian book into a movie.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review title: Master and Commander- the Best movie in the World
Review_body: Master and Commander was an AWESOME movie. IT had action all throughout it. Jack Aubrey is such a mastermind and such a good sailor. Oeter Weir did such a great job in directing this movie. He is such a great director. The Movie is based on Patrick O'Brien's series. The books are wonderful. All I have to say about this movie is positive... and i can go on all day about it! It is on of the most involved movies out there. It is awesome. Rusell Crowe is awesome in it, so is Paul Bettany. Max Benitz and Max Pirkis were awesome, they are both very good actors! The movie would not have been the same without them. I cannot wait for the second master and commander! it is going to be so good! i cant wait to see what happens.!
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: There is a scene in MASTER AND COMMANDER: THE FAR SIDE OF THE WORLD where the captain of a British Naval ship, circa 1805, debates the difference between duty and passion. Having passed on an opportunity to make wonderful new discoveries in favor of the pursuit of a massive French war ship, the scene manages to make a rather eloquent, yet subtle comment on the nature of man and his place within the world. The beauty of this film is that there are many such moments where the viewer is simultaneously bombarded with thematic musings, exciting action sequences, great acting and historical accuracy to the point where it becomes difficult to take it all in at once. Those of you looking for something more like Pirates of the Caribbean will be disappointed as this film is short on action and long on character development. There are only two major battle sequences, separated by more than an hour and a half of time. And while they are great; violently realistic and dramatically involving, the real guts of this film lies in the human stories told along the way. The director, Peter Weir, highlights his ability to tell an intimate story amidst a grand backdrop much like he did in The Truman Show. We get to know these men, their strengths and weaknesses and we see how the long and hard voyage plays on their minds over the film's progression. In one scene, a young officer feels the pressure of his men's dismissive stares and decides to end matters in his own way, afraid of what may be in store for him should he stick it out. Weir does a good job at highlighting the many facets of seafaring life. If you're looking for an intelligent and thought-provoking journey into the life of a 19th Century British Naval Vessell, look no further. Master and Commander has the depth of a good Discovery Channel show and the action worthy of almost any other high-seas adventure that comes to mind.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: Except for the trip around South America, the Surprise always kept her guns run out. This was not the normal way of sailing these ships. If ventilation was needed, only the gun ports were opened. The guns were kept inside ready to be loaded, and THEN run out. You wouldn't keep them loaded and run out all of the time.Remember that these guns used black powder and if you kept them loaded and ready to fire all of the time, the gunpowder would be so damp that they wouldn't fire when you needed them.Speaking of the guns, the ones the Surprise carried were capable of shooting through 2 feet of oak at 400 yards. If they had moved close enough, the cannon balls would not have bounced off. They finally got the chance when they were disguised as a whaler.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: Hat tip to Gary Jules for the intro music. But this confused and muddled arc had the potential to be so much more. Shoddy directing combined with top notch acting gets a 7 out of 10 from this reviewer. The characters grow on you. The ones you hate you learn to love. And the ones you like you come to despise. It's not a pretty story. Kudos for philosophy. And for going against political correctness and killing off those whom the world will never miss. Kudos also for the funeral director who is droll to the max and provides some welcome and much needed comic relief, but he's not sufficient to save this badly executed drama arc.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: The only thing I have to say about this film is by way of a question.When are they going to make the sequel?This film was so well done that I get more out of it each time I see it. It has personality, authority, authenticity, spectacle, and maturity.Under the direction and writing of Peter Weir, the story moves along from element to element with pace and interest. The characters are rich and filled with personality and are brought to life with great actors.The sound and vision give such life to the film. The cannonballs fly, the fog wreaths about the ships, the sea writhes and heaves.I want more and I've been waiting more than a decade now.There are so many books in the series that surely the makers have enough material for another two or three (or more) films. The fans are waiting.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review title: Superb - This will remain my favourite film ever.
Review_body: I bought a video of this film, then a DVD because the surround sound is marvellous for the soundtrack of this film. I can't count the number of times I have watched it and as soon as I had seen it I began reading all of the Patrick O'Brian 'Aubrey and Maturin' books. When I cameto the end of the novels I felt quite bereaved. I hope that Aubrey and Maturin were not one film wonders and that further movies about the pair will eventually be made. O'Brian's research was impeccable and the film helps to bring the naval history of Napoleonic times truly to life. Crowe and Paul Bettany were also superbly cast, although Bettany does not quite resemble the Maturin of the books and there is little evidence of his spying activities. This is not a criticism however, simply an observation. Wonderful film. I think possibly my favourite of all time. AND... I am glad there were no women in it. I think if there had been it would have taken away the sheer adventurousness (is that a word?)of it. I almost forgot to mention the wonderful music score. I particularly liked the music Crowe and Bettany played in the times they weren't warding off the dastardly 'Acheron'. I am hoping that the soundtrack has been recorded. I haven't seen it on sale but I suspect it must be out there somewhere. One further point about the message written by the twenty year old girl. I am sixty four years old but this did not make me less enthralled with the 'action'. I could almost feel as if I were one of the crew of the 'Surprise', who were also marvellously cast. I am not a great 'movie goer' and so I missed seeing it on the big screen which I would not have done if I had known what a superb film it was.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: Personally said this is maybe the best movie I watched in my entire life, and I've been watching quite a lot of movies. Gave it the rating 10 but it deserves 11/10, and this is not a lot for the movie of this caliber. I don't want to overhype this movie, but I can definitely explain why is this a masterpiece.First to say this movie won 2 oscars one for sound editing and the other one for cinematography, which is quite a success considering it came out in the same year as the last of LOTR movie series.Secondly the acting is as good as any of the godfather movies or any other classics, the effort put into each sentence and phrase to be said correctly and naturally is astonishing. Peter Weir (the director) used the exact sentences, measures and phrases that British sailors used back in Napoleonic wars. This required for Peter to study history of Napoleonic wars and ship journals to find inspiration, also every each actor in movie managed to pull off Weir's idea of a movie without any mistake and you can't find a single moment in movie where you can say acting wasn't on the highest level.I don't what to give away any spoilers, if you want to watch the movie you will see that story revolves around every character and every each of them has a deep life story and reason to be on that ship, every person has his interests and hobbies which makes this film soo natural. Movie consists of main story and stories of people on that ship. And it flows like a wind in the sails.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: The first time I watched this movie, I was a bit too young to appreciate it. When I got a bit older and I viewed it again, I was hooked.Contrary to some expectations, this movie isn't a pure-action film about two ships trying to destroy each other. It's more of a 'life aboard a man-of-war thing. The attention to characters and details is superb, and the actors (especially Crowe and Bettany) make the entire crew of the Surprise come alive. I especially liked the dialog: the arguments between Captain Aubrey and Dr. Maturin, some of the exchanges between the midshipmen (when Will is in sickbay, and when Hollom is about to commit suicide), and some of the dialog gems between the ordinary seamen.The lack of romance in this film is not unnerving: in fact, it's a refreshing change. An action film with good characters and no romance...hurray! Folks, if you're looking for a film that moves at breakneck speed with lots of action, this is not for you. If you want something that requires some thinking and patience, "Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World" might be it.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review title: Overrated? Boring? I beg to differ. One of the most authentic movies ever created.
Review_body: What's not to like about this movie? I've seen this film a dozen times and never tire of it. Peter Weir has created something more than a film here. He's created an unforgettable experience, time machine that actually places you on board the HMS Surprise.His attention to detail for that period is almost perfect. The dialog is accurate for that time in history and closely follows the Patrick O'Brian books (the film is a combination of two O'Brian books). Some have criticized the movie as dull, boring, etc., the books have been criticized as that, but Weir has made a film here that doesn't follow today's tired format full of explosions and trite dialog. This is definitely a "thinking man's" film.Paul Bettany is outstanding as Dr. Stephen Maturin and Russell Crowe is the perfect casting choice for Capt. Jack Aubrey. Bettany is a highly underrated actor, if you want my opinion. He plays the role of the on-board surgeon quite well.In fact the entire acting crew has been perfectly cast. My only disappointment is there are no plans to produce more movies from the fascinating series of O'Brian books.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review title: Superb interpretation of life at sea in that period
Review_body: Peter Wier's Master and Commander is a great tribute to his attention to detail and his feel for the period. His casting created a crew that was totally credible with faces that truly matched the period. All the acting is superb and the story told true to the spirit of O'Brien. As a fan of these books and a trans Atlantic traveler in tall ships I applaud Peter's attention to detail and his enthusiasm for the brief. It has to be my favourite film of all time. I have just found the extended version of the film with commentary from Peter and details of how the film was made. Incredible. So good. Thank you Peter, for giving us sea life from that period. The story was based on the Hunting of the Essex, so all based on truth. Wonderful. A great director.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review title: A tribute to the Main Star
Review_body: The movie was fascinating. Interesting and quite accurate of the way of life (and death) in those times. I am a big fan of the author. Alos, I have worked and sailed on a number of tall ships. The tall ship that appears in the film is (or was) the "HMS" Rose. She is a replica of a real British ship that was - by necessity - one of the reasons for the beginning of the American Navy. When I sailed on her she was under the command of Capt. Baily, one of the finest tall ship skippers I have ever had the pleasure of knowing. The beauty and stateliness's of the Rose was captured perfectly by the director and film crews. It was a thrilling chance for me and all film goers to experience the majesty of a bygone time.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review title: One of the all time greats
Review_body: A must see! Every frame of this movie really is a work of art. The scenary, the music, soundeffects and the charcters. A true shame it got in the shadow of lotr 3 when released.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: The books, I think, are the best novels ever written. O'Brian takes you into that period (the British Royal Navy, 200 years ago), gives you a wealth of detail, touches of delightful humour, and characters you feel you really *know*.All of which makes life difficult for someone wanting to bring the books to the screen.All credit to Peter Weir and the crew behind the camera for taking a lot of trouble to recreate the physical world of a wooden warship in the age of sail ... but all too often, I was left saying things like "Jack Aubrey wouldn't say that", "Maturin wouldn't speak like that" or "Pullings doesn't look like that." And there are plot weaknesses too - the Acheron taking the Surprise off guard, as though she knew exactly where the Surprise would be? There's no suggestion that Jack Aubrey had any kind of rendezvous to meet, so how could the Acheron know? And one of the characters says, of the Acheron's mission, "It could tip the balance in the war," or some such. Rubbish. It is an out of the way mission, to which the Surprise, an out-of-date frigate, can safely be sent. And then, after Jack turns back from his pursuit to help Maturin, he finds that his quarry has turned back too, and it's never explained why.Read the books, by all means, and savour all their richness. Then, by all means, watch the movie for a faithful physical recreation of that world ... but no more.
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: I really like the historical aspects of the movie. Well done, one of the best historical-fiction movie I have ever seen!
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review_body: I thought this movie was very tedious. It had one decent battle scene at the beginning and a marginal battle scene at the end. Everything in the middle was uninteresting filler. They spent more time on the Galapagos islands then anywhere else looking at animal specimens that I couldn't care less about. If I wanted that I'd have watched Jaques Cousteau. I was expecting a movie about wooden naval ships, but those were more of a background scene in this movie. The character of the captain was also as shallow and see through as plastic wrap. All the other characters around him has to tell the audience how great the captain is because the captain character sure couldn't demonstrate it on his own. The political correctness was also nauseating. Make better use of your time and money by checking out something else. Now let's try others capable actors and not about a fiction movie but the true life of french privateers where this movie tend to go, Robert Surcouf life is 10 times more interesting and passionating than the phantasm of O'Brian book, just a movie telling how Surcouf captured the HMS Kent and so much more British warships would not be a story close to reality, it would be the reality of this times!
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World

Review title: An amazing movie that deserves a better rating
Review_body: I made this account so that I could specifically rate this movie what it deserves
Movie_name: Master and Commander - The Far Side of the World
